snippet: Concern about technology — the printing press, the steam engine or the computer — supplanting humans is not new. But this time may be different.
abstract: The Upshot; technological breakthroughs are enabling machines to do knowledge jobs and service jobs, in addition to factory and clerical work; digital technology has over 15-year period inserted itself into nearly every aspect of life even as job market has fallen into long malaise; many economists are not sure about whether technology will create as many jobs as it destroyed, which was the case with previous technological leaps (Series: Nonemployed).
lead_paragraph: Concern about technology — the printing press, the steam engine or the computer — supplanting humans is not new. But this time may be different.

headline.main: As Robots Grow Smarter, American Workers Struggle to Keep Up
headline.print_headline: Smarter Robots Move Deeper Into Workplace
